Description: Papyrus written with black ink with legal document, parts of 3 ll. on recto, verso pasted down. Cession of 20 aruras of land at Armant by Ouaininis son of Pakhnoumis (name restored from P BM EA 10389) to Teos son of Haryothes (both parties are native of Aswan); the scribe is Neshor son of Khapokhrates. Cf. P BM EA 10389. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Early Ptolemaic. prob. Ptol. Philadelphus".
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.99-100, pl.86-7)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete -beginning of text missing)
